description: Good morning,  it’s Georgie here in Sydney. Here’s what you need to know today...Today’s must-reads:• Albanese’s ebbing support• RBA warns on inflation dangers• China’s Li to visit New Zealand
title: Albanese’s Slumping Support

description: Donald Trump will meet with Senate Republicans on Thursday, the latest effort among Washington policymakers to plot out priorities if the former president wins a second term.
title: Trump Will Meet With Senate Republicans Ahead of CEO Event

description: Future Mexico elections may require a larger budget to avoid the issues that citizens voting abroad experienced during this year’s presidential election, said the official in charge of the process.
title: Mexico Voting Abroad May Require Bigger Budget, Official Says

description: Keir Starmer is committing to ban the sale of highly caffeinated energy drinks to teenagers if his Labour Party wins the UK election next month, part of a broader strategy to improve child mental and physical health.
title: Labour Would Ban Sales of High Caffeine Energy Drinks to Teens

description: Mexico’s ruling party will keep the market in mind as it moves to discuss constitutional reforms, Senate Majority Leader Ricardo Monreal said in an interview.
title: Market Is a Factor in Mexico Congress’ Next Steps, Senator Says

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, congressional reporter Billy House previews a Republican attempt to hold Attorney General Merrick Garland in contempt of Congress. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Republicans Take Aim at Garland as Biden Probes Falter

description: The United Nations Security Council adopted a US-crafted resolution endorsing its cease-fire plan for the Israel-Hamas war, a push that’s part of Washington’s wide campaign to keep up momentum for a proposal that neither side has fully committed to.
title: UN Security Council Adopts US Resolution Backing Gaza Cease-Fire

description: A New Jersey businessman told a federal jury in New York he gave US Senator Robert Menendez’s wife an envelope with $15,000 in cash before the politician promised to look into halting a criminal insurance fraud investigation by state officials.
title: Menendez Collaborator Says He Handed $15,000 to Senator’s Wife

description: The Mountain Valley Pipeline is asking regulators for permission to begin operating after finishing the controversial project.
title: Manchin-Backed Gas Pipeline Seeks US Approval to Start Up

description: Hong Kong’s top court is losing a third overseas judge as the city’s judiciary comes under growing scrutiny over its role in Beijing’s crackdown on dissent in the former British colony.
title: Top Hong Kong Court Loses Third Overseas Judge as Scrutiny Rises

description: European officials are in talks to keep gas flowing through a key Russia-Ukraine pipeline, as they race to prevent Moscow’s war further damaging the continent’s energy supplies.
title: Europe in Talks to Keep Russia-Ukraine Gas Pipeline Flowing

description: Talks are ongoing between French far-right leader Marine Le Pen’s National Rally party and lawmaker Marion Marechal over the possibility of joining forces to take on French President Emmanuel Macron in upcoming legislative elections.
title: French Far-Right Parties Edge Toward Coalition Against Macron

description: Far-right leader Marine Le Pen’s National Rally is seen garnering 34% of voter intentions in the first round of upcoming French legislative elections, compared with 19% for President Emmanuel Macron’s ruling party, according to a poll.
title: Le Pen’s Party Seen Leading With 34% in French Election, Poll Shows

description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban ruled out holding early parliamentary elections to cement his advantage in local and European Union ballots following a surprisingly strong showing by a new rival.
title: Orban Rules Out Early Hungary Elections After New Rival’s Surge

description: Deputy Labour leader Angela Rayner plans to establish a new civil service unit to drive a push to end homelessness if the opposition wins power in next month’s general election, tapping an approach previously used by former Prime Minister Tony Blair.
title: Starmer Deputy Revives Blair-Era Approach to Cut UK Homelessness

description: The US unveiled sanctions on 10 people, ships and companies in a fresh bid to choke off commodity revenue for Yemen’s Houthi rebels, who have disrupted trade flows through the Red Sea with repeated attacks on commercial shippers.
title: US Imposes Fresh Sanctions Targeting Houthi Oil Shipments

description: The latest draft of the House Armed Services Committee’s $895 billion defense spending bill would require the US to conduct joint exercises with Israel aimed at improving the countries’ ability to fight militants and smugglers in underground tunnels, part of a push to counter a key advantage of Hamas and other groups.
title: US and Israel Would Conduct Annual Tunnel Exercises Under House Plan

description: The Czech Republic accused Russia of organizing and financing a failed arson attack by a foreigner who tried to set public buses on fire in Prague last week.
title: Czechs Blame Russia for Backing Failed Arson Attack in Prague

description: Malawi’s government said a search has been launched for a plane carrying Vice President Saulos Chilima and nine other passengers that went missing earlier on Monday.
title: Malawi Launches Search for Missing Plane Carrying Vice President

description: President Emmanuel Macron’s decision to call a snap election has plunged France into uncertainty — but it may prove to be the making of Jordan Bardella, Marine Le Pen’s 28-year-old selfie-loving political heir.
title: Le Pen’s 28-Year-Old Political Heir Faces a Make-or-Break Moment

description: Rishi Sunak faced last-minute calls by cabinet ministers to add new tax cuts and a tougher migration policy to the Conservative manifesto after early drafts provoked disquiet over the lack of big-ticket pledges that might prevent a heavy defeat in the UK general election.
title: Sunak Faces Late Tory Revolt Over UK Tax Cuts and Migration

description: Hunter Biden’s defense team rested their case Monday without his testimony, leaving only closing arguments before the jury will be instructed to deliberate whether he is guilty of violating federal firearm laws.
title: Hunter Biden’s Defense Rests in Gun Case Without His Testimony

description: Poland’s Finance Minister Andrzej Domanski expects the country will face the European Union’s procedure for its excessive deficit last year.
title: Poland Expects to Face EU Infringement Procedure Over Deficit

description: Finland said that a Russian military aircraft violated its airspace on Monday in the first such move since the Nordic country joined the NATO alliance last year.
title: Russian Military Plane Suspected of Violating Finnish Airspace

description: Iran is scheduled to hold a snap presidential election on June 28 following the death of Ebrahim Raisi in a helicopter crash. While ultimate power in Iran rests with the Supreme Leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, the president can sometimes influence policy by drawing on a base of popular support, political affiliations and links to powerful institutions. The vote comes at a time of heightened tensions between Iran and the West, with Tehran mobilizing a regional network of proxy militias to target
title: How Iran Will Elect Its President, and Why He Matters

description: Nirmala Sitharaman was reappointed India’s finance minister in Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s new coalition government, providing policy continuity in one of the world’s fastest-growing economies.
title: India Reappoints Nirmala Sitharaman as Finance Minister

description: The US Supreme Court declined to question the $8 billion annual subsidy that helps cover the cost of telecom services for poor people and residents of rural areas, turning away two appeals that sought to rein in federal regulatory power.
title: FCC’s $8 Billion Phone Subsidy Survives Supreme Court Challenge

description: The US Supreme Court agreed to consider killing a multibillion-dollar shareholder lawsuit that accuses Meta Platforms Inc. of misleading investors about the data-harvesting scandal involving political consulting firm Cambridge Analytica.
title: Meta Gets Supreme Court Review on Investor Data-Harvesting Suit

description: South Africa’s parliament will reconvene on Friday to elect the president, the chief justice announced, as political parties continue talks aimed at forming a new government.
title: South Africa Parliament Will Reconvene Friday to Elect President

description: Benny Gantz’s resignation from Israel’s war cabinet appears dramatic from afar but is unlikely to alter the course of the conflict in Gaza or influence other key policies of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.
title: Israel’s Pursuit of Hamas in Gaza Seen Unswayed by Gantz Exit

description: Ireland’s main opposition party Sinn Fein has suffered a set back in the country’s local elections in a blow to its ambitions to enter government for the first time in the next election.
title: Ireland’s Opposition Sinn Fein Takes Hit in Local, EU Elections

description: In theory, it should be smooth sailing for Ursula von der Leyen to clinch a second term as European Commission President after her party won the most seats in the EU elections. In reality, it may be more complicated.
title: Von der Leyen Faces Tricky Balancing Act to Seal Second EU Term

description: Currencies in most of the world’s developing economies were weaker as the European Union’s weekend ballots boosted political risks following a series of high-profile elections driving market volatility across the globe.
title: Emerging Currencies Drop as EU Elections Add to Political Risks

description: The UK’s undecided voters are turning away from Rishi Sunak’s Conservatives, according to polling analysis that if replicated in the July 4 general election would extinguish the prime minister’s already slim chances of clinging on to power.
title: UK’s Undecided Voters Reject Sunak in Latest Blow to Tory Hopes

description: This weekend’s European Union elections marked the end of the bloc’s greenest parliament ever after concerns over everything from climate policies to migration gave the populists a boost.
title: Green Wipeout Means Fights Ahead to Keep Europe’s Climate Goals

description: With Labour and the Conservatives set to unveil their election manifestos this week, it’s UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s Tories who need to produce a game-changer, with Bloomberg’s poll of polls showing the incumbent party has failed to make a dent on the opposition in 19 days of campaigning so far.
title: Tories Fail to Dent Labour’s Lead, Bloomberg’s Poll of Polls Finds

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Is Emmanuel Macron Being Rash or Bold in Calling Election?

description: Europe’s leaders are putting their citizens at risk if they don’t facilitate deals and accords to tighten the region’s defense industry, Leonardo SpA Chief Executive Officer Roberto Cingolani said.
title: Europe Defense Faces a ‘Come Together’ Moment, Leonardo CEO Says

description: Some 90 countries will attend a Ukraine summit this weekend, Swiss officials said on Monday, but key countries from the so called Global South have still to confirm their attendance.
title: Ukraine Push for Support Draws 45 Leaders to Swiss Summit

description: Ukraine’s top official tasked with reconstruction abruptly resigned and accused the government of hindering his efforts after the nation’s premier blocked his request to attend a conference in Berlin.
title: Ukraine Recovery Official Abruptly Resigns Amid Infighting

description: The first Russian oil tanker attempting to deliver crude while under US sanctions made a secret cargo transfer onto another ship, a sign of the lengths to which Moscow is going to undermine the effectiveness of American restrictions on its fleet.
title: Russian Oil Tanker Does Secret Cargo Switch Near Singapore to Dodge US Sanctions

description: The Federal Trade Commission should study how the largest US technology platforms and financial institutions control content, Republican Commissioner Melissa Holyoak said, renewing a Trump-era proposal targeting companies that control “access to the digital commons.”
title: FTC’s Holyoak Urges Study of Online Censorship by Tech Giants

description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s ruling coalition is on course for another drubbing in September when elections are held in three eastern regions where the far-right Alternative for Germany is the strongest party.
title: Scholz Heading for Another Election Rout in Eastern Germany

description: Premier Giorgia Meloni projected optimism after winning the European vote in Italy, vowing Rome would play a “fundamental” role in the bloc while calling on the EU to reflect on the low turnout seen across the union.
title: Italy’s Meloni Says Government ‘Emboldened’ by EU Vote Victory

description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa said the country’s next administration must sustain policy reforms aimed at accelerating economic growth, as key political parties meet to discuss helping form a new government.
title: Ramaphosa Urges More Reform as Coalition Talks Enter Crunch Week

description: The centrist Liberal Democrats pledged to raise taxes on banks and close loopholes around capital gains levies to fund a £9.4 billion ($12 billion) package for social care and the National Health Service, as it tries to take seats from Rishi Sunak’s Conservatives in the July 4 election.
title: Liberal Democrats Seek to Tax UK Banks, Squeeze Rich to Fund NHS

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin is set to visit North Korea and Vietnam soon, taking rare trips to Moscow’s traditional security partners as he seeks help for his grinding war on Ukraine.
title: Putin Set for Rare Visits to Security Partners North Korea and Vietnam

description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s new cabinet will see the return of several old faces from his earlier administration, although there’s no clarity on the positions they’ll hold, including the key finance post.
title: Modi Chooses Old Faces in Cabinet as Finance Post Awaited

description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken lands in Egypt on Monday and is expected to meet President Abdel Fattah El-Sisi as the US attempts to push a last-ditch cease-fire proposal publicly endorsed by President Joe Biden but brushed off so far by both Israel and Hamas.
title: Blinken Returns to Mideast as US Presses Stalled Cease-Fire Plan

description: Donald Trump will be interviewed Monday by New York probation officers whose sentencing recommendation to a judge will influence how much time, if any, he will spend behind bars after being convicted of falsifying business records, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: Trump to Be Interviewed Virtually by New York Probation Officers

description: Spain, Portugal, Greece are among the euro area’s fastest growing economies.
title: Europe’s Onetime Crisis Economies Are Now Outperformers

description: Chinese Premier Li Qiang will visit New Zealand later this week amid rising tensions between Beijing and its western trading partners.
title: Chinese Premier Li Qiang to Visit New Zealand This Week

description: Donald Trump will undergo an interview with a New York City probation officer on Monday, according to a person familiar with the matter, following the guilty verdict in a hush-money trial that made him the first former US president to be convicted of a felony.
title: Trump to Sit for Probation Interview Monday Following Conviction

description: Support for Australia’s center-left Labor government has slumped after a week of poor economic news and political tensions over immigration, according to a new poll, leaving Prime Minister Anthony Albanese’s party at its equal lowest point since it won power two years ago.
title: Australian PM’s Support Slumps After Weak GDP Growth Figures

description: The sister of North Korea’s leader warned of reprisals against South Korea after it resumed loudspeaker broadcasts for the first time in years, signaling an escalation of tensions along one of the world’s most militarized borders.
title: Kim’s Sister Warns of Further Reprisals as Trash Balloons Fly Over Border
